2.text: Hear my words, ye wise [men]; and give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.

3.text: For the ear trieth words, as the palate tasteth food.

4.text: Let us choose for ourselves what is right; let us know among ourselves what is good!

5.text: For Job hath said, I am righteous, and God hath taken away my judgment:

6.text: Should I lie against my right? My wound is incurable without transgression.

7.text: What man is like Job? he drinketh up scorning like water,

8.text: And goeth in company with workers of iniquity, and walketh with wicked men.

9.text: For he hath said, It profiteth not a man if he delight himself in God.

10.text: Therefore hearken unto me, ye men of understanding: Far be wickedness from God, and wrong from the Almighty!

11.text: For a manâ€™s work will he render to him, and cause every one to find according to [his] way.

12.text: Yea, surely, God acteth not wickedly, and the Almighty perverteth not judgment.

13.text: Who hath entrusted to him the earth? and who hath disposed the whole world?

14.text: If he only thought of himself, [and] gathered unto him his spirit and his breath,

15.text: All flesh would expire together, and man would return to the dust.

16.text: If now [thou hast] understanding, hear this: give ear to the voice of my words!

17.text: Should he that hateth right indeed govern? and wilt thou condemn the All-just?

18.text: Shall one say to a king, Belial? to nobles, Wicked?

19.text: [How then to him] that accepteth not the persons of princes, nor regardeth the rich man more than the poor? for they are all the work of his hands.

20.text: In a moment they die, even at midnight the people are convulsed and pass away; and the strong are taken away without hand.

21.text: For his eyes are upon the ways of man, and he seeth all his steps.

22.text: There is no darkness, nor shadow of death, where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.

23.text: For he doth not long consider a man, to bring him before God in judgment.

24.text: He breaketh in pieces mighty men without inquiry, and setteth others in their stead;

25.text: Since he knoweth their actions; and he overthroweth [them] in the night, and they are crushed.

26.text: He striketh them as wicked men in the open sight of others,

27.text: Because they have turned back from him, and would consider none of his ways;

28.text: So that they cause the cry of the poor to come unto him, and he heareth the cry of the afflicted.

29.text: When he giveth quietness, who then will disturb? and when he hideth [his] face, who shall behold him? and this towards a nation, or towards a man alike;

30.text: That the ungodly man reign not, that the people be not ensnared.

31.text: For hath he said unto God, I bear [chastisement], I will not offend;

32.text: What I see not, teach thou me; if I have done wrong, I will do so no more?

33.text: Shall he recompense according to thy mind? for thou hast refused [his judgment]; for thou so choosest, and not I; speak then what thou knowest.

34.text: Men of understanding will say to me, and a wise man who heareth me:

35.text: Job hath spoken without knowledge, and his words were not with intelligence.

36.text: Would that Job may be tried unto the end, because of [his] answers after the manner of evil men!

37.text: For he addeth rebellion unto his sin, he clappeth [his hands] among us, and multiplieth his words against God.
